column1: The origin of the hatred between Colonna and Orsini is unknown
column2: for the archives of the former have as yet thrown no light upon the subject
column3: and those of the latter were almost entirely destroyed by fire in the last century. In the year 1305
column4: Pope Clement the Fifth was elected Pope at Perugia. He was a Frenchman
column6: the candidate of Philip the Fair
column7: whose tutor had been a Colonna
column8: and he was chosen by the opposing factions of two Orsini cardinals because the people of Perugia were tired of a quarrel that had lasted eleven months
column9: and had adopted the practical and always infallible expedient of deliberately starving the conclave to a vote. Muratori calls it a scandalous and illicit election
column10: which brought about the ruin of Italy and struck a memorable blow at the power of the Holy See. Though not a great man
column11: Philip the Fair was one of the cleverest that ever lived. Before the election he had made his bishop swear upon the Sacred Host to accept his conditions
column12: without expressing them all; and the most important proved to be the transference of the Papal See to France.
